summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from August to September 2021 between FBI agents in New York and a U.S. Attorney's Office paralegal regarding a 'photo review/exhibit project.' The emails discuss scheduling calls to confirm the source of 51 photographs from a review project, indicating ongoing evidence preparation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email coordinating the photo review project, identified as an AUSA from the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Initial coordination for photo review project
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails FBI agents to schedule a call to discuss a game plan for a 'photo review/exhibit project'.

events.title: Paralegal submits photo spreadsheet for review
events.description: A paralegal from the U.S. Attorney's Office sends a spreadsheet of 51 photographs from the photo review project to the FBI, requesting confirmation of the source disk or device for each photo.

keyFacts: The emails concern a 'photo review/exhibit project' involving evidence, likely photographs, related to an investigation.
A paralegal compiled a spreadsheet of 51 photographs for which the FBI needed to confirm the source disk or device.
The correspondence indicates ongoing collaboration between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI in late 2021.
Multiple email addresses are redacted, showing standard practice of withholding specific agent and staff names in public releases.
